title: Jhin was the only champion introduced this season with any significant and consistent pick rate

replies.body: not exactly a fair thing to say, the poppy shen reworks along with graves were basically full new champions, and they were picked a lot.

> [{quoted}](name=PhantomGG,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=q5Z2FTnz,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-11-09T08:54:12.169+0000)
>
> not exactly a fair thing to say, the poppy shen reworks along with graves were basically full new champions, and they were picked a lot.

For a month then everybody realized Shen was shit and not Shenpai anymore. (Although poopy became poppy and graves went to vaping so they kept on getting picked)
Bard and Poppy are both decent along with Ryze and definitely {{champion:136}} , especially in the competitive scene.
Ryze and Sol both have really below average pick rates in solo queue though and I'm pretty sure Bard and Poppy aren't from season 6.
New Poppy came early season 6

Jhin's great. Super strong and fun, but feels fair to face.

Gangplank is another champion in that pool, for me.
I'm fairly certain that Graves has done just as much as Jhin has, if not more due to coming out earlier. Same with Caitlyn, for that matter.
That has nothing to do with this season though.
Cait and Graves are both Season 6 reworks bub.
That was pre-season honey.

Preseason still counts as the season it precedes. That's why it's called **Pre**-season and not **Post**-Season. Likewise, the assassin reworks we just got will count as Season 7 reworks and not Season 6 ones since they naturally saw no play during Season 6.
Pre-season is pre-season, not season. It's its own thing. Otherwise there would be no point in differentiating in the first place.

The differentiation is that Pre-season is the part of the season that occurs before ranked play starts. It works exactly the same in League as it does in sports: The 2016 NFL pre-season is still considered part of the 2016 NFL Season, just the part before games count for anything.
It really doesn't, and that's why I specified season. You're free to to think of pre-season as part of the season if you want, but if I was including the pre-season I'd had said pre-season.
Revert Shen.

Jhin is simply the best designed champion to date with clear counterplay, clear strengths, clear weaknesses and touches that thematic side really well that captures him as a character. Jhin is strong because of the utility. He might be slightly overtuned but with the changes for armour pen to lethality it'll be a little difficult to continue using that build and he may lose a bit of power because of that.

I agree he's a really well designed champion. Even when I lose against him it never really feels unfair because I can always think of something I could had done to outplay him. He's also a blast to play as.
Just as expected from the guy who also designed Jinx, another champion with a really perfect gameplay and identity integration.
Maybe if everyone stopped playing fucking Zed, Vayne, Ekko and Yasuo every game in every position because they are "fun", there would be space for other champions.
jhin's been op and never gotten nerfed is why
buff my girl sheep of doom again,  wanna cuddle her more, shyvana is scaly and not soft
